name: Bulbasaur
description: Seed Pokémon: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

name: Ivysaur
description: Seed Pokémon: There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight, Ivysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

name: Venusaur
description: Seed Pokémon: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

name: Charmander
description: Lizard Pokémon: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

name: Charmeleon
description: Flame Pokémon: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.

name: Charizard
description: Flame Pokémon: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

name: Squirtle
description: Tiny Turtle Pokémon: Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

name: Wartortle
description: Turtle Pokémon: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s toughness as a battler.

name: Blastoise
description: Shellfish Pokémon: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

name: Caterpie
description: Worm Pokémon: Its body is soft and weak. In nature, its perpetual fate is to be seen by others as food.

name: Metapod
description: Cocoon Pokémon: Its hard shell doesn’t crack a bit even if Pikipek pecks at it, but it will tip over, spilling out its insides.

name: Butterfree
description: Butterfly Pokémon: Nectar from pretty flowers is its favorite food. In fields of flowers, it has heated battles with Cutiefly for territory.

name: Weedle
description: Hairy Bug Pokémon: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

name: Kakuna
description: Cocoon Pokémon: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

name: Beedrill
description: Poison Bee Pokémon: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

name: Pidgey
description: Tiny Bird Pokémon: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

name: Pidgeotto
description: Bird Pokémon: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

name: Pidgeot
description: Bird Pokémon: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

name: Rattata
description: Mouse Pokémon: This Pokémon is common but hazardous. Its sharp incisors can easily cut right through hard wood.

name: Raticate
description: Mouse Pokémon: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.

name: Spearow
description: Tiny Bird Pokémon: Due to its short wings, it can’t fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

name: Fearow
description: Beak Pokémon: In Alola, fish Pokémon are its prey. It can be seen circling above the ocean searching for food.

name: Ekans
description: Snake Pokémon: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

name: Arbok
description: Cobra Pokémon: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.

name: Pikachu
description: Mouse Pokémon: While sleeping, it generates electricity in the sacs in its cheeks. If it’s not getting enough sleep, it will be able to use only weak electricity.

name: Raichu
description: Mouse Pokémon: Because so many Trainers like the way Pikachu looks, you don’t see this Pokémon very often.

name: Sandshrew
description: Mouse Pokémon: When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it heads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a lot of geothermal heat and dries itself out.

name: Sandslash
description: Mouse Pokémon: Thanks to its thick claws, it’s good at climbing trees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park themselves in trees and go right to sleep.

name: Nidoran♀
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.

name: Nidorina
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

name: Nidoqueen
description: Drill Pokémon: Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

name: Nidoran♂
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.

name: Nidorino
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.

name: Nidoking
description: Drill Pokémon: Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

name: Clefairy
description: Fairy Pokémon: Bathed in moonlight, its wings glow faintly. Without even flapping, Clefairy rises into the air, where it dances around.

name: Clefable
description: Fairy Pokémon: Some scientists believe that it gazes intently at the sky on nights with a full moon because it’s homesick.

name: Vulpix
description: Fox Pokémon: It manipulates balls of fire to catch its prey. If you raise one from when it’s young, it will grow close to you like a puppy Pokémon.

name: Ninetales
description: Fox Pokémon: The flickering flames it spews from its mouth leave its opponents hypnotized. Then, this extremely intelligent Pokémon attacks.

name: Jigglypuff
description: Balloon Pokémon: The songs they sing are totally different depending on the region they live in. Some even sound like they’re shouting!

name: Wigglytuff
description: Balloon Pokémon: When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might, and its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they can grow 20 times larger!

name: Zubat
description: Bat Pokémon: Their skin is so thin that they’ll be burned if sunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they gather together to warm one another’s bodies.

name: Golbat
description: Bat Pokémon: They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in one go. They have been known to drink so much blood that they can no longer fly.

name: Oddish
description: Weed Pokémon: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.

name: Gloom
description: Weed Pokémon: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.

name: Vileplume
description: Flower Pokémon: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.

name: Paras
description: Mushroom Pokémon: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

name: Parasect
description: Mushroom Pokémon: Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional medicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola are not of very good quality.

name: Venonat
description: Insect Pokémon: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.

name: Venomoth
description: Poison Moth Pokémon: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.

name: Diglett
description: Mole Pokémon: Around their crops, farmers plant the kind of tree that Diglett like to eat as a way of getting Diglett to plow the fields for them.

name: Dugtrio
description: Mole Pokémon: Dugtrio’s heads are sleek and smooth and incredibly hard. It can dig through any soil with its headbutts.

name: Meowth
description: Scratch Cat Pokémon: It loves coins, so if you give it one, you can make friends with Meowth easily. But it’s fickle, so you can’t count on that friendship lasting.

name: Persian
description: Classy Cat Pokémon: This Pokémon is popular with rich people. It’s also targeted by hunters who are after the jewel in its forehead.

name: Psyduck
description: Duck Pokémon: It has been found that its brain cells are 10 times more active when Psyduck is experiencing a headache.

name: Golduck
description: Duck Pokémon: A professional swimmer, it can continue swimming for two days straight by waving its long tail skillfully.

name: Mankey
description: Pig Monkey Pokémon: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.

name: Primeape
description: Pig Monkey Pokémon: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.

name: Growlithe
description: Puppy Pokémon: It has lived alongside humans since ages ago. Its bones have been found in excavations of ruins from the Stone Age.

name: Arcanine
description: Legendary Pokémon: There are so many old tales about them that they’re called legendary Pokémon, but there are way more of them around than you’d expect.

name: Poliwag
description: Tadpole Pokémon: The direction of the swirl on their stomachs differs depending on where they live. Poliwag aficionados can tell them apart at a glance.

name: Poliwhirl
description: Tadpole Pokémon: Its health suffers when its skin dries out, so be sure to moisturize it diligently.

name: Poliwrath
description: Tadpole Pokémon: The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.

name: Abra
description: Psi Pokémon: It can read others’ minds and will teleport away when danger approaches. You must clear your mind if you want to catch it.

name: Kadabra
description: Psi Pokémon: It possesses strong mental capabilities, but its psychic powers are halved when it’s not holding a silver spoon.

name: Alakazam
description: Psi Pokémon: If it trusts someone deeply, it will let them have one of its spoons. Anything you eat with that spoon is apparently delicious.

name: Machop
description: Superpower Pokémon: It likes food that’s highly nutritious because its instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.

name: Machoke
description: Superpower Pokémon: A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly well-developed muscles have captured the imagination of many an artist.

name: Machamp
description: Superpower Pokémon: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It’s said to have mastered every martial art in the world.

name: Bellsprout
description: Flower Pokémon: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

name: Weepinbell
description: Flycatcher Pokémon: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

name: Victreebel
description: Flycatcher Pokémon: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.

name: Tentacool
description: Jellyfish Pokémon: Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1% contains the organ that makes its poison.

name: Tentacruel
description: Jellyfish Pokémon: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it’s a warning sign.

name: Geodude
description: Rock Pokémon: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.

name: Graveler
description: Rock Pokémon: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

name: Golem
description: Megaton Pokémon: It detonates its own body. The power from that explosion can propel it up steep mountain paths with amazing speed.

name: Ponyta
description: Fire Horse Pokémon: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.

name: Rapidash
description: Fire Horse Pokémon: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

name: Slowpoke
description: Dopey Pokémon: Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can easily be found lying around, they’re a precious ingredient for cooking.

name: Slowbro
description: Hermit Crab Pokémon: Shellder, in its greed to suck out more and more sweetness from Slowbro’s tail, has metamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.

name: Magnemite
description: Magnet Pokémon: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.

name: Magneton
description: Magnet Pokémon: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.

name: Farfetch'd
description: Wild Duck Pokémon: Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.

name: Doduo
description: Twin Bird Pokémon: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.

name: Dodrio
description: Triple Bird Pokémon: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

name: Seel
description: Sea Lion Pokémon: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don’t bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

name: Dewgong
description: Sea Lion Pokémon: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.

name: Grimer
description: Sludge Pokémon: The wastewater coming from factories is clean these days, so Grimer have nothing to eat. They’re said to be on the verge of extinction.

name: Muk
description: Sludge Pokémon: Because they scatter germs everywhere, they’ve long been targeted for extermination, leading to a steep decline in their population.

name: Shellder
description: Bivalve Pokémon: Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank, the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.

name: Cloyster
description: Bivalve Pokémon: Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for Slowpoke from time to time.

name: Gastly
description: Gas Pokémon: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It’s said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.

name: Haunter
description: Gas Pokémon: It’s dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you’re feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won’t be able to go back home.

name: Gengar
description: Shadow Pokémon: Even your home isn’t safe. Gengar will lurk in whatever dark corner of a room it can find and wait for its chance to catch its prey.

name: Onix
description: Rock Snake Pokémon: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

name: Drowzee
description: Hypnosis Pokémon: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn’t particularly like eating them.

name: Hypno
description: Hypnosis Pokémon: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can’t sleep at night in hospitals.

name: Krabby
description: River Crab Pokémon: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.

name: Kingler
description: Pincer Pokémon: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.

name: Voltorb
description: Ball Pokémon: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

name: Electrode
description: Ball Pokémon: One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.

name: Exeggcute
description: Egg Pokémon: Although they are the same size as other Exeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite heavy. Their shells are packed full.

name: Exeggutor
description: Coconut Pokémon: Each of its three heads has its own thoughts. When they want to go in different directions, Exeggutor becomes unable to move.

name: Cubone
description: Lonely Pokémon: It wears its mother’s skull on its head, so no one knows what its bare face looks like. However, it’s clear that it’s always crying.

name: Marowak
description: Bone Keeper Pokémon: They thump their bones rhythmically to communicate among themselves. There are nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.

name: Hitmonlee
description: Kicking Pokémon: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

name: Hitmonchan
description: Punching Pokémon: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.

name: Lickitung
description: Licking Pokémon: It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it licks always stinks afterward, so whether it’s really clean is...questionable.

name: Koffing
description: Poison Gas Pokémon: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.

name: Weezing
description: Poison Gas Pokémon: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.

name: Rhyhorn
description: Spikes Pokémon: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.

name: Rhydon
description: Drill Pokémon: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.

name: Chansey
description: Egg Pokémon: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.

name: Tangela
description: Vine Pokémon: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

name: Kangaskhan
description: Parent Pokémon: You shouldn’t get close to the child when it’s playing outside its mother’s pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.

name: Horsea
description: Dragon Pokémon: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

name: Seadra
description: Dragon Pokémon: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.

name: Goldeen
description: Goldfish Pokémon: The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like fins has earned it the name “princess of the water.”

name: Seaking
description: Goldfish Pokémon: To attract females, males dance on the river’s floor. The females gather around the male that dances most gracefully.

name: Staryu
description: Star Shape Pokémon: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!

name: Starmie
description: Mysterious Pokémon: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.

name: Mr. Mime
description: Barrier Pokémon: It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming. If you don’t act impressed, it will attack you with a double slap!

name: Scyther
description: Mantis Pokémon: Some call it a ninja. Its movements— imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave the air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.

name: Jynx
description: Human Shape Pokémon: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.

name: Electabuzz
description: Electric Pokémon: While it’s often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.

name: Magmar
description: Spitfire Pokémon: The hotter the place, the better they feel. Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than those in other areas.

name: Pinsir
description: Stag Beetle Pokémon: Although it’s tough, it can’t handle cold well. When night falls, it buries itself in leafage and sleeps.

name: Tauros
description: Wild Bull Pokémon: The climate seems to be related to the reason Tauros in Alola are a little calmer than those in other regions.

name: Magikarp
description: Fish Pokémon: Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water doesn’t bother them at all. They live in waters all over the world!

name: Gyarados
description: Atrocious Pokémon: The energy from evolution stimulated its brain cells strongly, causing it to become very ferocious.

name: Lapras
description: Transport Pokémon: They’ve been so cherished that there’s now an overabundance. The fish Pokémon population has declined in waters with too many Lapras.

name: Ditto
description: Transform Pokémon: It transforms into whatever it sees. If the thing it’s transforming into isn’t right in front of it, Ditto relies on its memory—so sometimes it fails.

name: Eevee
description: Evolution Pokémon: Its genes are easily influenced by its surroundings. Even its face starts to look like that of its Trainer.

name: Vaporeon
description: Bubble Jet Pokémon: It detects nearby moisture with its fin. When its fin begins trembling rapidly, that means rain will fall in a few hours.

name: Jolteon
description: Lightning Pokémon: Its fur stands on end, becoming like needles it fires at enemies. Once they’re weakened, it finishes them off with a 10,000 volt shock.

name: Flareon
description: Flame Pokémon: The flame chamber inside its body ignites when Flareon gets agitated, reaching temperatures of up to 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Porygon
description: Virtual Pokémon: It was built 20 years ago by scientists who dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have yet to come true.

name: Omanyte
description: Spiral Pokémon: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Those Helix Fossils are excavated from areas that were once oceans long, long ago.

name: Omastar
description: Spiral Pokémon: It wraps its prey in its tentacles to immobilize them and then finishes them off with its sharp fangs.

name: Kabuto
description: Shellfish Pokémon: This Pokémon became extinct everywhere, except in a few areas. It protects itself with its hard shell.

name: Kabutops
description: Shellfish Pokémon: It swims at speeds of roughly 29 knots, quickly closing in on its prey and slashing into them with its scythes to finish them off.

name: Aerodactyl
description: Fossil Pokémon: It flew through the open skies over the ancient continent as if they were its own. When it touched ground, its walk was weak and slow.

name: Snorlax
description: Sleeping Pokémon: It has no interest in anything other than eating. Even if you climb up on its stomach while it’s napping, it doesn’t seem to mind at all!

name: Articuno
description: Freeze Pokémon: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

name: Zapdos
description: Electric Pokémon: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

name: Moltres
description: Flame Pokémon: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

name: Dratini
description: Dragon Pokémon: It sheds its skin—almost on a daily basis—and grows larger. Its skin is soft just after it’s been shed.

name: Dragonair
description: Dragon Pokémon: Some say that if you see it at the start of the year, flying through the sky and twisting its body, you’ll be healthy all year long.

name: Dragonite
description: Dragon Pokémon: You’ll often hear tales of this kindhearted Pokémon rescuing people or Pokémon that are drowning.

name: Mewtwo
description: Genetic Pokémon: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

name: Mew
description: New Species Pokémon: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

name: Chikorita
description: Leaf Pokémon: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

name: Bayleef
description: Leaf Pokémon: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

name: Meganium
description: Herb Pokémon: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

name: Cyndaquil
description: Fire Mouse Pokémon: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

name: Quilava
description: Volcano Pokémon: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

name: Typhlosion
description: Volcano Pokémon: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

name: Totodile
description: Big Jaw Pokémon: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

name: Croconaw
description: Big Jaw Pokémon: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

name: Feraligatr
description: Big Jaw Pokémon: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

name: Sentret
description: Scout Pokémon: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

name: Furret
description: Long Body Pokémon: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

name: Hoothoot
description: Owl Pokémon: It cries out at the same time every day. A long time ago, people cherished it and considered it a divine messenger sent to tell the time.

name: Noctowl
description: Owl Pokémon: When it turns its head entirely upside down, you know it’s troubled by something. If you don’t leave it be, it will peck you.

name: Ledyba
description: Five Star Pokémon: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

name: Ledian
description: Five Star Pokémon: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

name: Spinarak
description: String Spit Pokémon: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

name: Ariados
description: Long Leg Pokémon: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

name: Crobat
description: Bat Pokémon: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.

name: Chinchou
description: Angler Pokémon: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.

name: Lanturn
description: Light Pokémon: It lives far down in the depths of the ocean. It blinds its prey with light, using the moment they’re dazzled to swallow them whole.

name: Pichu
description: Tiny Mouse Pokémon: It has electric sacs in its cheeks. When they’re fully charged, Pichu plays very energetically.

name: Cleffa
description: Star Shape Pokémon: Said to have ridden here on a shooting star, Cleffa seem to appear in places where meteorites have struck in the past.

name: Igglybuff
description: Balloon Pokémon: Left to its own devices, it will constantly practice singing. You should make it take a break so it doesn’t hurt its throat.

name: Togepi
description: Spike Ball Pokémon: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.

name: Togetic
description: Happiness Pokémon: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.

name: Natu
description: Tiny Bird Pokémon: The look in its eyes gives the impression that it’s carefully observing you. If you approach it, Natu will hop away.

name: Xatu
description: Mystic Pokémon: While it can see the future, it has no desire to change it, which is probably why it remains motionless at all times.

name: Mareep
description: Wool Pokémon: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

name: Flaaffy
description: Wool Pokémon: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

name: Ampharos
description: Light Pokémon: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

name: Bellossom
description: Flower Pokémon: A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.

name: Marill
description: Aqua Mouse Pokémon: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.

name: Azumarill
description: Aqua Rabbit Pokémon: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons enable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.

name: Sudowoodo
description: Imitation Pokémon: The result of its holding the same pose all the time is arms that have become supple yet strong.

name: Politoed
description: Frog Pokémon: The longer and more luxurious the curled hair on its head, the greater the number of Poliwag and Poliwhirl that will obey it.

name: Hoppip
description: Cottonweed Pokémon: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

name: Skiploom
description: Cottonweed Pokémon: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

name: Jumpluff
description: Cottonweed Pokémon: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

name: Aipom
description: Long Tail Pokémon: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

name: Sunkern
description: Seed Pokémon: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

name: Sunflora
description: Sun Pokémon: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

name: Yanma
description: Clear Wing Pokémon: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

name: Wooper
description: Water Fish Pokémon: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.

name: Quagsire
description: Water Fish Pokémon: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.

name: Espeon
description: Sun Pokémon: Psychic power builds up in the orb on its forehead as it bathes in the sunshine. Espeon is not good at battling at night.

name: Umbreon
description: Moonlight Pokémon: It lurks in the dark of night looking for prey. At the moment it pounces, the rings on its body glow dimly but ominously.

name: Murkrow
description: Darkness Pokémon: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

name: Slowking
description: Royal Pokémon: It’s called “the sage of the sea.” It engages in battles of wits with Oranguru, but the result is usually a draw.

name: Misdreavus
description: Screech Pokémon: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.

name: Unown
description: Symbol Pokémon: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

name: Wobbuffet
description: Patient Pokémon: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

name: Girafarig
description: Long Neck Pokémon: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

name: Pineco
description: Bagworm Pokémon: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

name: Forretress
description: Bagworm Pokémon: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

name: Dunsparce
description: Land Snake Pokémon: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.

name: Gligar
description: Fly Scorpion Pokémon: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

name: Steelix
description: Iron Snake Pokémon: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth’s core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

name: Snubbull
description: Fairy Pokémon: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

name: Granbull
description: Fairy Pokémon: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

name: Qwilfish
description: Balloon Pokémon: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

name: Scizor
description: Pincer Pokémon: Once it has identified something as an enemy, it will continue beating them with its steel-hard pincers until there’s nothing left but scraps.

name: Shuckle
description: Mold Pokémon: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

name: Heracross
description: Single Horn Pokémon: It roams through forests searching for sweet nectar. Although it boasts fantastic physical strength, it’s not that good at flying.

name: Sneasel
description: Sharp Claw Pokémon: It blends into the dark of night to ambush its prey. Sneasel will attack Sandshrew, but its hard skin can cause Sneasel’s claws to snap off.

name: Teddiursa
description: Little Bear Pokémon: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

name: Ursaring
description: Hibernator Pokémon: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

name: Slugma
description: Lava Pokémon: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

name: Magcargo
description: Lava Pokémon: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

name: Swinub
description: Pig Pokémon: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.

name: Piloswine
description: Swine Pokémon: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

name: Corsola
description: Coral Pokémon: In Alola, where their natural enemies Mareanie are plentiful, many Corsola have stubby branches on their heads.

name: Remoraid
description: Jet Pokémon: Also known as the “sniper of the seas,” its water gun can hit prey without fail from over 300 feet away.

name: Octillery
description: Jet Pokémon: It usually sleeps in caves. The pitch-black ink that Octillery spits is also used for cooking.

name: Delibird
description: Delivery Pokémon: It wraps food in its tail to carry it around. The Delibird with the biggest tail is the boss of the flock!

name: Mantine
description: Kite Pokémon: Many people have taken up surfing because they admire how magnificently Mantine swims.

name: Skarmory
description: Armor Bird Pokémon: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

name: Houndour
description: Dark Pokémon: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

name: Houndoom
description: Dark Pokémon: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

name: Kingdra
description: Dragon Pokémon: Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pokémon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.

name: Phanpy
description: Long Nose Pokémon: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

name: Donphan
description: Armor Pokémon: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

name: Porygon2
description: Virtual Pokémon: Even though it doesn’t die in the vacuum of space, it can’t move around very well in zero gravity.

name: Stantler
description: Big Horn Pokémon: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

name: Smeargle
description: Painter Pokémon: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

name: Tyrogue
description: Scuffle Pokémon: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.

name: Hitmontop
description: Handstand Pokémon: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokémon travels faster spinning than it does walking.

name: Smoochum
description: Kiss Pokémon: Highly perceptive sensors, Smoochum’s lips are kept moist by its daily application of tree sap.

name: Elekid
description: Electric Pokémon: When its horns shine a bluish white, that’s the sign it’s fully charged. You’ll get a shocking jolt if you touch it!

name: Magby
description: Live Coal Pokémon: Its body temperature is always around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. If Magby falls into a small- enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.

name: Miltank
description: Milk Cow Pokémon: Its milk is delicious and chock-full of nutrients. However, if you drink too much, it could make your stomach hurt, so be careful.

name: Blissey
description: Happiness Pokémon: This Pokémon is overflowing with love. Only Chansey that share a strong bond with their Trainer can evolve, so people say.

name: Raikou
description: Thunder Pokémon: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

name: Entei
description: Volcano Pokémon: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

name: Suicune
description: Aurora Pokémon: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

name: Larvitar
description: Rock Skin Pokémon: Raised on nutrients it finds in the dirt, it eats roughly a mountain’s worth of dirt before it becomes a pupa.

name: Pupitar
description: Hard Shell Pokémon: This dangerous pupa thrashes about. Its shell is as hard as bedrock, containing its gradually forming new body within.

name: Tyranitar
description: Armor Pokémon: This Pokémon is a mobile disaster, leaving mountains crumbled and houses destroyed in its wake.

name: Lugia
description: Diving Pokémon: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

name: Ho-Oh
description: Rainbow Pokémon: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

name: Celebi
description: Time Travel Pokémon: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

name: Treecko
description: Wood Gecko Pokémon: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

name: Grovyle
description: Wood Gecko Pokémon: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

name: Sceptile
description: Forest Pokémon: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

name: Torchic
description: Chick Pokémon: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

name: Combusken
description: Young Fowl Pokémon: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

name: Blaziken
description: Blaze Pokémon: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

name: Mudkip
description: Mud Fish Pokémon: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

name: Marshtomp
description: Mud Fish Pokémon: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

name: Swampert
description: Mud Fish Pokémon: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

name: Poochyena
description: Bite Pokémon: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

name: Mightyena
description: Bite Pokémon: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

name: Zigzagoon
description: Tiny Raccoon Pokémon: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon may play dead to fool foes in battle.

name: Linoone
description: Rushing Pokémon: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.

name: Wurmple
description: Worm Pokémon: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

name: Silcoon
description: Cocoon Pokémon: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

name: Beautifly
description: Butterfly Pokémon: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

name: Cascoon
description: Cocoon Pokémon: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.

name: Dustox
description: Poison Moth Pokémon: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

name: Lotad
description: Water Weed Pokémon: Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this Pokémon is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.

name: Lombre
description: Jolly Pokémon: Lombre’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokémon’s hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.

name: Ludicolo
description: Carefree Pokémon: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in Ludicolo’s body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount of power.

name: Seedot
description: Acorn Pokémon: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pokémon by suddenly moving. This Pokémon polishes its body once a day using leaves.

name: Nuzleaf
description: Wily Pokémon: This Pokémon pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute with it. The sound of Nuzleaf’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of people lost in a forest.

name: Shiftry
description: Wicked Pokémon: Shiftry’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This Pokémon chooses to live quietly deep in forests.

name: Taillow
description: Tiny Swallow Pokémon: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

name: Swellow
description: Swallow Pokémon: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

name: Wingull
description: Seagull Pokémon: It builds nests in cliffs by the sea. It circles the skies above the ocean looking for its favorite food—Wishiwashi.

name: Pelipper
description: Water Bird Pokémon: It scoops up Wishiwashi in its huge beak and swallows them whole. It can devour more than 30 at one go!

name: Ralts
description: Feeling Pokémon: Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.

name: Kirlia
description: Emotion Pokémon: Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the Pokémon uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.

name: Gardevoir
description: Embrace Pokémon: Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon will try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.

name: Surskit
description: Pond Skater Pokémon: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

name: Masquerain
description: Eyeball Pokémon: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

name: Shroomish
description: Mushroom Pokémon: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

name: Breloom
description: Mushroom Pokémon: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

name: Slakoth
description: Slacker Pokémon: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

name: Vigoroth
description: Wild Monkey Pokémon: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

name: Slaking
description: Lazy Pokémon: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

name: Nincada
description: Trainee Pokémon: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.

name: Ninjask
description: Ninja Pokémon: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the Trainer’s abilities to the test.

name: Shedinja
description: Shed Pokémon: Shedinja is a peculiar Pokémon. It seems to appear unsought in a Poké Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokémon is entirely immobile—it doesn’t even breathe.

name: Whismur
description: Whisper Pokémon: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.

name: Loudred
description: Big Voice Pokémon: Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this Pokémon becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.

name: Exploud
description: Loud Noise Pokémon: Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokémon only raises its voice when it is in battle.

name: Makuhita
description: Guts Pokémon: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

name: Hariyama
description: Arm Thrust Pokémon: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

name: Azurill
description: Polka Dot Pokémon: Azurill’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this Pokémon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.

name: Nosepass
description: Compass Pokémon: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

name: Skitty
description: Kitten Pokémon: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

name: Delcatty
description: Prim Pokémon: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

name: Sableye
description: Darkness Pokémon: Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.

name: Mawile
description: Deceiver Pokémon: It has two mouths. The big jaws on the back of its head can’t taste anything, so that’s the mouth it uses to eat foods it doesn’t like.

name: Aron
description: Iron Armor Pokémon: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokémon.

name: Lairon
description: Iron Armor Pokémon: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.

name: Aggron
description: Iron Armor Pokémon: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

name: Meditite
description: Meditate Pokémon: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

name: Medicham
description: Meditate Pokémon: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

name: Electrike
description: Lightning Pokémon: Static electricity builds up all over its body as strands of its long fur rub together. This Pokémon boasts incredible speed.

name: Manectric
description: Discharge Pokémon: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.

name: Plusle
description: Cheering Pokémon: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

name: Minun
description: Cheering Pokémon: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

name: Volbeat
description: Firefly Pokémon: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

name: Illumise
description: Firefly Pokémon: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

name: Roselia
description: Thorn Pokémon: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokémon’s head contain a vicious poison.

name: Gulpin
description: Stomach Pokémon: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

name: Swalot
description: Poison Bag Pokémon: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

name: Carvanha
description: Savage Pokémon: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.

name: Sharpedo
description: Brutal Pokémon: It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to propel itself. It’s very sensitive to the scent of blood.

name: Wailmer
description: Ball Whale Pokémon: Due to their memories of when they once lived on land, pods of them will, very rarely, wash up on shore.

name: Wailord
description: Float Whale Pokémon: When a small Wailmer is attacked by Sharpedo or Dhelmise, its whole pod works together to protect it.

name: Numel
description: Numb Pokémon: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

name: Camerupt
description: Eruption Pokémon: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

name: Torkoal
description: Coal Pokémon: It burns coal to produce energy. When it has burned through all of its coal, it becomes unable to move.

name: Spoink
description: Bounce Pokémon: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

name: Grumpig
description: Manipulate Pokémon: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

name: Spinda
description: Spot Panda Pokémon: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!

name: Trapinch
description: Ant Pit Pokémon: It builds nests that double as traps, lying in wait for its prey to get caught. When night falls, it digs itself a spot beneath the sand to sleep.

name: Vibrava
description: Vibration Pokémon: It vibrates its wings to send out odd sound waves. Trainers who are with it need earplugs.

name: Flygon
description: Mystic Pokémon: People continue to have their hearts stolen by its enchanting songs and find themselves stranded in the desert.

name: Cacnea
description: Cactus Pokémon: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

name: Cacturne
description: Scarecrow Pokémon: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

name: Swablu
description: Cotton Bird Pokémon: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.

name: Altaria
description: Humming Pokémon: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

name: Zangoose
description: Cat Ferret Pokémon: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

name: Seviper
description: Fang Snake Pokémon: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

name: Lunatone
description: Meteorite Pokémon: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémon’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.

name: Solrock
description: Meteorite Pokémon: Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.

name: Barboach
description: Whiskers Pokémon: Its whiskers are filled with nerves. They can sense smells and flavors just as a person’s nose or tongue would.

name: Whiscash
description: Whiskers Pokémon: Its vision is not that good. It senses vibrations in the water with its whiskers to determine the location of its prey.

name: Corphish
description: Ruffian Pokémon: It can adapt very well to its environment. Feebas and Corphish are about the only Pokémon to live in stagnant ditches.

name: Crawdaunt
description: Rogue Pokémon: Its pincers often fall off. Unlike with Crabrawler or Clauncher, the meat in its claws is utterly nasty and stinking.

name: Baltoy
description: Clay Doll Pokémon: When they find others of their kind, they cry out loudly and gather together. Large numbers of them can be found in old graveyards.

name: Claydol
description: Clay Doll Pokémon: The ancient people who made it apparently modeled it after something that descended from the sky. It fires beams from both arms.

name: Lileep
description: Sea Lily Pokémon: It sticks to rocks with its powerful suckers and can’t be washed away no matter how rough the surf gets.

name: Cradily
description: Barnacle Pokémon: This carnivorous Pokémon lived in primordial seas. It catches prey in its eight tentacles and dissolves them with digestive fluid as it eats.

name: Anorith
description: Old Shrimp Pokémon: This is one kind of primeval bug Pokémon. With eight wings, it could apparently swim a lot faster than you’d expect.

name: Armaldo
description: Plate Pokémon: Armaldo adapted from living in water to living on land. It has been determined that it is the ancestor of some bug Pokémon.

name: Feebas
description: Fish Pokémon: Because of its wretched appearance, most people pay it no attention, but there are some who collect Feebas—and Feebas alone!

name: Milotic
description: Tender Pokémon: Its dwelling place is the bottom of big lakes. Those who behold its loveliness are said to have their hearts purified.

name: Castform
description: Weather Pokémon: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

name: Kecleon
description: Color Swap Pokémon: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

name: Shuppet
description: Puppet Pokémon: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”

name: Banette
description: Marionette Pokémon: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

name: Duskull
description: Requiem Pokémon: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.

name: Dusclops
description: Beckon Pokémon: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops’s bidding.

name: Tropius
description: Fruit Pokémon: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

name: Chimecho
description: Wind Chime Pokémon: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

name: Absol
description: Disaster Pokémon: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

name: Wynaut
description: Bright Pokémon: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.

name: Snorunt
description: Snow Hat Pokémon: Rich people from cold areas all share childhood memories of playing with Snorunt.

name: Glalie
description: Face Pokémon: Its actual body is a rock that isn’t particularly hard. Glalie absorbs moisture from the air and drapes itself in an armor of ice.

name: Spheal
description: Clap Pokémon: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.

name: Sealeo
description: Ball Roll Pokémon: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object’s aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.

name: Walrein
description: Ice Break Pokémon: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

name: Clamperl
description: Bivalve Pokémon: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.

name: Huntail
description: Deep Sea Pokémon: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.

name: Gorebyss
description: South Sea Pokémon: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.

name: Relicanth
description: Longevity Pokémon: The reason it hasn’t changed at all in a hundred million years is that it’s apparently already a perfect life-form.

name: Luvdisc
description: Rendezvous Pokémon: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.

name: Bagon
description: Rock Head Pokémon: Some theories suggest that its behavior of forcefully bashing its head into things stimulates cells that affect its evolution.

name: Shelgon
description: Endurance Pokémon: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.

name: Salamence
description: Dragon Pokémon: Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its body finally mutated, and at last it has its heart’s desire—wings.

name: Beldum
description: Iron Ball Pokémon: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.

name: Metang
description: Iron Claw Pokémon: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.

name: Metagross
description: Iron Leg Pokémon: It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy than a supercomputer, which enables it to calmly back them into a corner.

name: Regirock
description: Rock Peak Pokémon: Regirock’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.

name: Regice
description: Iceberg Pokémon: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.

name: Registeel
description: Iron Pokémon: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.

name: Latias
description: Eon Pokémon: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

name: Latios
description: Eon Pokémon: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

name: Kyogre
description: Sea Basin Pokémon: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

name: Groudon
description: Continent Pokémon: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

name: Rayquaza
description: Sky High Pokémon: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

name: Jirachi
description: Wish Pokémon: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.

name: Deoxys
description: DNA Pokémon: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

name: Turtwig
description: Tiny Leaf Pokémon: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

name: Grotle
description: Grove Pokémon: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

name: Torterra
description: Continent Pokémon: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

name: Chimchar
description: Chimp Pokémon: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

name: Monferno
description: Playful Pokémon: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

name: Infernape
description: Flame Pokémon: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

name: Piplup
description: Penguin Pokémon: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

name: Prinplup
description: Penguin Pokémon: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

name: Empoleon
description: Emperor Pokémon: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

name: Starly
description: Starling Pokémon: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

name: Staravia
description: Starling Pokémon: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

name: Staraptor
description: Predator Pokémon: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

name: Bidoof
description: Plump Mouse Pokémon: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

name: Bibarel
description: Beaver Pokémon: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

name: Kricketot
description: Cricket Pokémon: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

name: Kricketune
description: Cricket Pokémon: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

name: Shinx
description: Flash Pokémon: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

name: Luxio
description: Spark Pokémon: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

name: Luxray
description: Gleam Eyes Pokémon: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.

name: Budew
description: Bud Pokémon: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

name: Roserade
description: Bouquet Pokémon: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

name: Cranidos
description: Head Butt Pokémon: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

name: Rampardos
description: Head Butt Pokémon: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

name: Shieldon
description: Shield Pokémon: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

name: Bastiodon
description: Shield Pokémon: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

name: Burmy
description: Bagworm Pokémon: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

name: Wormadam
description: Bagworm Pokémon: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

name: Mothim
description: Moth Pokémon: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

name: Combee
description: Tiny Bee Pokémon: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

name: Vespiquen
description: Beehive Pokémon: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

name: Pachirisu
description: EleSquirrel Pokémon: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

name: Buizel
description: Sea Weasel Pokémon: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

name: Floatzel
description: Sea Weasel Pokémon: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

name: Cherubi
description: Cherry Pokémon: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

name: Cherrim
description: Blossom Pokémon: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.

name: Shellos
description: Sea Slug Pokémon: When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out of it. The liquid is thought to be something like greasy sweat.

name: Gastrodon
