description: Sea Slug Pokémon: Their shape and color change, depending on their environment and diet. There are many of them at beaches where the waves are calm.

name: Ambipom
description: Long Tail Pokémon: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.

name: Drifloon
description: Balloon Pokémon: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.

name: Drifblim
description: Blimp Pokémon: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s thought to carry away people and Pokémon.

name: Buneary
description: Rabbit Pokémon: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked by an enemy.

name: Lopunny
description: Rabbit Pokémon: It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

name: Mismagius
description: Magical Pokémon: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

name: Honchkrow
description: Big Boss Pokémon: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

name: Glameow
description: Catty Pokémon: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

name: Purugly
description: Tiger Cat Pokémon: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

name: Chingling
description: Bell Pokémon: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

name: Stunky
description: Skunk Pokémon: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

name: Skuntank
description: Skunk Pokémon: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

name: Bronzor
description: Bronze Pokémon: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

name: Bronzong
description: Bronze Bell Pokémon: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

name: Bonsly
description: Bonsai Pokémon: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.

name: Mime Jr.
description: Mime Pokémon: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.

name: Happiny
description: Playhouse Pokémon: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can’t move.

name: Chatot
description: Music Note Pokémon: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

name: Spiritomb
description: Forbidden Pokémon: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

name: Gible
description: Land Shark Pokémon: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

name: Gabite
description: Cave Pokémon: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

name: Garchomp
description: Mach Pokémon: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

name: Munchlax
description: Big Eater Pokémon: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.

name: Riolu
description: Emanation Pokémon: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise during this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.

name: Lucario
description: Aura Pokémon: Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.

name: Hippopotas
description: Hippo Pokémon: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

name: Hippowdon
description: Heavyweight Pokémon: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

name: Skorupi
description: Scorpion Pokémon: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

name: Drapion
description: Ogre Scorpion Pokémon: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

name: Croagunk
description: Toxic Mouth Pokémon: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

name: Toxicroak
description: Toxic Mouth Pokémon: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

name: Carnivine
description: Bug Catcher Pokémon: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

name: Finneon
description: Wing Fish Pokémon: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

name: Lumineon
description: Neon Pokémon: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

name: Mantyke
description: Kite Pokémon: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.

name: Snover
description: Frost Tree Pokémon: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

name: Abomasnow
description: Frost Tree Pokémon: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

name: Weavile
description: Sharp Claw Pokémon: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!

name: Magnezone
description: Magnet Area Pokémon: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.

name: Lickilicky
description: Licking Pokémon: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.

name: Rhyperior
description: Drill Pokémon: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

name: Tangrowth
description: Vine Pokémon: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.

name: Electivire
description: Thunderbolt Pokémon: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

name: Magmortar
description: Blast Pokémon: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

name: Togekiss
description: Jubilee Pokémon: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.

name: Yanmega
description: Ogre Darner Pokémon: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

name: Leafeon
description: Verdant Pokémon: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.

name: Glaceon
description: Fresh Snow Pokémon: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.

name: Gliscor
description: Fang Scorpion Pokémon: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

name: Mamoswine
description: Twin Tusk Pokémon: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

name: Porygon-Z
description: Virtual Pokémon: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.

name: Gallade
description: Blade Pokémon: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

name: Probopass
description: Compass Pokémon: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

name: Dusknoir
description: Gripper Pokémon: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

name: Froslass
description: Snow Land Pokémon: It’s said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!

name: Rotom
description: Plasma Pokémon: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

name: Uxie
description: Knowledge Pokémon: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

name: Mesprit
description: Emotion Pokémon: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

name: Azelf
description: Willpower Pokémon: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

name: Dialga
description: Temporal Pokémon: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

name: Palkia
description: Spatial Pokémon: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

name: Heatran
description: Lava Dome Pokémon: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

name: Regigigas
description: Colossal Pokémon: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

name: Giratina
description: Renegade Pokémon: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

name: Cresselia
description: Lunar Pokémon: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

name: Phione
description: Sea Drifter Pokémon: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

name: Manaphy
description: Seafaring Pokémon: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

name: Darkrai
description: Pitch-Black Pokémon: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

name: Shaymin
description: Gratitude Pokémon: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

name: Arceus
description: Alpha Pokémon: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

name: Victini
description: Victory Pokémon: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

name: Snivy
description: Grass Snake Pokémon: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Servine
description: Grass Snake Pokémon: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Serperior
description: Regal Pokémon: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

name: Tepig
description: Fire Pig Pokémon: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Pignite
description: Fire Pig Pokémon: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Emboar
description: Mega Fire Pig Pokémon: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

name: Oshawott
description: Sea Otter Pokémon: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

name: Dewott
description: Discipline Pokémon: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

name: Samurott
description: Formidable Pokémon: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

name: Patrat
description: Scout Pokémon: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

name: Watchog
description: Lookout Pokémon: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Lillipup
description: Puppy Pokémon: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s commands, and easy to raise.

name: Herdier
description: Loyal Dog Pokémon: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.

name: Stoutland
description: Big-Hearted Pokémon: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

name: Purrloin
description: Devious Pokémon: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

name: Liepard
description: Cruel Pokémon: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

name: Pansage
description: Grass Monkey Pokémon: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

name: Simisage
description: Thorn Monkey Pokémon: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

name: Pansear
description: High Temp Pokémon: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Simisear
description: Ember Pokémon: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

name: Panpour
description: Spray Pokémon: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

name: Simipour
description: Geyser Pokémon: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

name: Munna
description: Dream Eater Pokémon: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

name: Musharna
description: Drowsing Pokémon: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

name: Pidove
description: Tiny Pigeon Pokémon: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

name: Tranquill
description: Wild Pigeon Pokémon: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

name: Unfezant
description: Proud Pokémon: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

name: Blitzle
description: Electrified Pokémon: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

name: Zebstrika
description: Thunderbolt Pokémon: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Roggenrola
description: Mantle Pokémon: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.

name: Boldore
description: Ore Pokémon: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.

name: Gigalith
description: Compressed Pokémon: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath the surface.

name: Woobat
description: Bat Pokémon: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

name: Swoobat
description: Courting Pokémon: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

name: Drilbur
description: Mole Pokémon: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Excadrill
description: Subterrene Pokémon: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

name: Audino
description: Hearing Pokémon: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

name: Timburr
description: Muscular Pokémon: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

name: Gurdurr
description: Muscular Pokémon: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

name: Conkeldurr
description: Muscular Pokémon: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

name: Tympole
description: Tadpole Pokémon: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

name: Palpitoad
description: Vibration Pokémon: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

name: Seismitoad
description: Vibration Pokémon: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

name: Throh
description: Judo Pokémon: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

name: Sawk
description: Karate Pokémon: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

name: Sewaddle
description: Sewing Pokémon: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Swadloon
description: Leaf-Wrapped Pokémon: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

name: Leavanny
description: Nurturing Pokémon: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

name: Venipede
description: Centipede Pokémon: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

name: Whirlipede
description: Curlipede Pokémon: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

name: Scolipede
description: Megapede Pokémon: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

name: Cottonee
description: Cotton Puff Pokémon: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.

name: Whimsicott
description: Windveiled Pokémon: Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.

name: Petilil
description: Bulb Pokémon: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

name: Lilligant
description: Flowering Pokémon: It’s well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.

name: Basculin
description: Hostile Pokémon: When a school of Basculin appears in a lake, everything else disappears, except for Corphish and Crawdaunt. That’s how violent Basculin are.

name: Sandile
description: Desert Croc Pokémon: Sandile’s still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It’s called “the cleaner of the desert.”

name: Krokorok
description: Desert Croc Pokémon: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

name: Krookodile
description: Intimidation Pokémon: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

name: Darumaka
description: Zen Charm Pokémon: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Darmanitan
description: Blazing Pokémon: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

name: Maractus
description: Cactus Pokémon: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

name: Dwebble
description: Rock Inn Pokémon: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

name: Crustle
description: Stone Home Pokémon: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

name: Scraggy
description: Shedding Pokémon: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.

name: Scrafty
description: Hoodlum Pokémon: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.

name: Sigilyph
description: Avianoid Pokémon: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

name: Yamask
description: Spirit Pokémon: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

name: Cofagrigus
description: Coffin Pokémon: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

name: Tirtouga
description: Prototurtle Pokémon: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.

name: Carracosta
description: Prototurtle Pokémon: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

name: Archen
description: First Bird Pokémon: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.

name: Archeops
description: First Bird Pokémon: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.

name: Trubbish
description: Trash Bag Pokémon: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.

name: Garbodor
description: Trash Heap Pokémon: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.

name: Zorua
description: Tricky Fox Pokémon: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

name: Zoroark
description: Illusion Fox Pokémon: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

name: Minccino
description: Chinchilla Pokémon: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.

name: Cinccino
description: Scarf Pokémon: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.

name: Gothita
description: Fixation Pokémon: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

name: Gothorita
description: Manipulate Pokémon: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

name: Gothitelle
description: Astral Body Pokémon: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.

name: Solosis
description: Cell Pokémon: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

name: Duosion
description: Mitosis Pokémon: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

name: Reuniclus
description: Multiplying Pokémon: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

name: Ducklett
description: Water Bird Pokémon: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

name: Swanna
description: White Bird Pokémon: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Vanillite
description: Fresh Snow Pokémon: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.

name: Vanillish
description: Icy Snow Pokémon: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.

name: Vanilluxe
description: Snowstorm Pokémon: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day’s light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.

name: Deerling
description: Season Pokémon: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

name: Sawsbuck
description: Season Pokémon: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

name: Emolga
description: Sky Squirrel Pokémon: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

name: Karrablast
description: Clamping Pokémon: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

name: Escavalier
description: Cavalry Pokémon: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

name: Foongus
description: Mushroom Pokémon: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

name: Amoonguss
description: Mushroom Pokémon: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

name: Frillish
description: Floating Pokémon: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

name: Jellicent
description: Floating Pokémon: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It’s rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

name: Alomomola
description: Caring Pokémon: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

name: Joltik
description: Attaching Pokémon: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Galvantula
description: EleSpider Pokémon: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

name: Ferroseed
description: Thorn Seed Pokémon: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

name: Ferrothorn
description: Thorn Pod Pokémon: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

name: Klink
description: Gear Pokémon: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

name: Klang
description: Gear Pokémon: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.

name: Klinklang
description: Gear Pokémon: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

name: Tynamo
description: EleFish Pokémon: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

name: Eelektrik
description: EleFish Pokémon: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

name: Eelektross
description: EleFish Pokémon: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

name: Elgyem
description: Cerebral Pokémon: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It’s said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.

name: Beheeyem
description: Cerebral Pokémon: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.

name: Litwick
description: Candle Pokémon: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

name: Lampent
description: Lamp Pokémon: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

name: Chandelure
description: Luring Pokémon: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

name: Axew
description: Tusk Pokémon: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

name: Fraxure
description: Axe Jaw Pokémon: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

name: Haxorus
description: Axe Jaw Pokémon: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

name: Cubchoo
description: Chill Pokémon: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

name: Beartic
description: Freezing Pokémon: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

name: Cryogonal
description: Crystallizing Pokémon: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Shelmet
description: Snail Pokémon: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

name: Accelgor
description: Shell Out Pokémon: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

name: Stunfisk
description: Trap Pokémon: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Mienfoo
description: Martial Arts Pokémon: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.

name: Mienshao
description: Martial Arts Pokémon: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you’re in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!

name: Druddigon
description: Cave Pokémon: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.

name: Golett
description: Automaton Pokémon: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.

name: Golurk
description: Automaton Pokémon: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.

name: Pawniard
description: Sharp Blade Pokémon: It follows Bisharp’s orders to a tee when it attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent, Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.

name: Bisharp
description: Sword Blade Pokémon: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn’t even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.

name: Bouffalant
description: Bash Buffalo Pokémon: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

name: Rufflet
description: Eaglet Pokémon: Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in order to gain their acceptance.

name: Braviary
description: Valiant Pokémon: Known as “the hero of the skies,” this Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will never retreat, even when it’s injured.

name: Vullaby
description: Diapered Pokémon: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

name: Mandibuzz
description: Bone Vulture Pokémon: It’s always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.

name: Heatmor
description: Anteater Pokémon: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

name: Durant
description: Iron Ant Pokémon: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

name: Deino
description: Irate Pokémon: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

name: Zweilous
description: Hostile Pokémon: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

name: Hydreigon
description: Brutal Pokémon: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

name: Larvesta
description: Torch Pokémon: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

name: Volcarona
description: Sun Pokémon: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

name: Cobalion
description: Iron Will Pokémon: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

name: Terrakion
description: Cavern Pokémon: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

name: Virizion
description: Grassland Pokémon: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

name: Tornadus
description: Cyclone Pokémon: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

name: Thundurus
description: Bolt Strike Pokémon: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

name: Reshiram
description: Vast White Pokémon: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.

name: Zekrom
description: Deep Black Pokémon: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

name: Landorus
description: Abundance Pokémon: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

name: Kyurem
description: Boundary Pokémon: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

name: Keldeo
description: Colt Pokémon: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

name: Meloetta
description: Melody Pokémon: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

name: Genesect
description: Paleozoic Pokémon: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Chespin
description: Spiny Nut Pokémon: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Quilladin
description: Spiny Armor Pokémon: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

name: Chesnaught
description: Spiny Armor Pokémon: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Fennekin
description: Fox Pokémon: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Braixen
description: Fox Pokémon: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Delphox
description: Fox Pokémon: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

name: Froakie
description: Bubble Frog Pokémon: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Frogadier
description: Bubble Frog Pokémon: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

name: Greninja
description: Ninja Pokémon: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Bunnelby
description: Digging Pokémon: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

name: Diggersby
description: Digging Pokémon: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.

name: Fletchling
description: Tiny Robin Pokémon: Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.

name: Fletchinder
description: Ember Pokémon: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.

name: Talonflame
description: Scorching Pokémon: Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet. It approaches at high speeds and smacks them down to the ground with its powerful kick.

name: Scatterbug
description: Scatterdust Pokémon: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

name: Spewpa
description: Scatterdust Pokémon: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Vivillon
description: Scale Pokémon: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

name: Litleo
description: Lion Cub Pokémon: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

name: Pyroar
description: Royal Pokémon: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

name: Flabébé
description: Single Bloom Pokémon: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

name: Floette
description: Single Bloom Pokémon: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

name: Florges
description: Garden Pokémon: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

name: Skiddo
description: Mount Pokémon: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

name: Gogoat
description: Mount Pokémon: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

name: Pancham
description: Playful Pokémon: It’s desperate to intimidate its opponents. Be nice and pretend to be scared if you catch it glaring at you intensely.

name: Pangoro
description: Daunting Pokémon: Pangoro is the type to talk with its fists. It doesn’t say much as it pummels opponents with enough force to send a dump truck flying.

name: Furfrou
description: Poodle Pokémon: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Espurr
description: Restraint Pokémon: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

name: Meowstic
description: Constraint Pokémon: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

name: Honedge
description: Sword Pokémon: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.

name: Doublade
description: Sword Pokémon: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

name: Aegislash
description: Royal Sword Pokémon: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

name: Spritzee
description: Perfume Pokémon: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

name: Aromatisse
description: Fragrance Pokémon: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

name: Swirlix
description: Cotton Candy Pokémon: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

name: Slurpuff
description: Meringue Pokémon: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

name: Inkay
description: Revolving Pokémon: When exchanging information with others of its kind, it flashes the light-emitting spots on its body in a complex rhythm.

name: Malamar
description: Overturning Pokémon: It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are supremely sharp.

name: Binacle
description: Two-Handed Pokémon: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

name: Barbaracle
description: Collective Pokémon: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.

name: Skrelp
description: Mock Kelp Pokémon: It’s not good at swimming, so it clings to the seaweed. In the Alola region, it’s often found near Dhelmise.

name: Dragalge
description: Mock Kelp Pokémon: It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey and then takes them down with a poisonous liquid strong enough to melt metal.

name: Clauncher
description: Water Gun Pokémon: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it’s terrible at swimming straight.

name: Clawitzer
description: Howitzer Pokémon: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it’s exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.

name: Helioptile
description: Generator Pokémon: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

name: Heliolisk
description: Generator Pokémon: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

name: Tyrunt
description: Royal Heir Pokémon: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s trying to frolic with are gravely injured.

name: Tyrantrum
description: Despot Pokémon: The king of the ancient world, it can easily crunch a car with the devastating strength of its enormous jaws.

name: Amaura
description: Tundra Pokémon: Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.

name: Aurorus
description: Tundra Pokémon: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around –240 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Sylveon
description: Intertwining Pokémon: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer’s feelings.

name: Hawlucha
description: Wrestling Pokémon: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s also skilled at using superb submission holds.

name: Dedenne
description: Antenna Pokémon: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

name: Carbink
description: Jewel Pokémon: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.

name: Goomy
description: Soft Tissue Pokémon: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.

name: Sliggoo
description: Soft Tissue Pokémon: Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put gloves on if you’re going to touch it.

name: Goodra
description: Dragon Pokémon: Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat, and the combination of the two makes enemies’ attacks slide right off.

name: Klefki
description: Key Ring Pokémon: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.

name: Phantump
description: Stump Pokémon: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.

name: Trevenant
description: Elder Tree Pokémon: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.

name: Pumpkaboo
description: Pumpkin Pokémon: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

name: Gourgeist
description: Pumpkin Pokémon: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

name: Bergmite
description: Ice Chunk Pokémon: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

name: Avalugg
description: Iceberg Pokémon: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

name: Noibat
description: Sound Wave Pokémon: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.

name: Noivern
description: Sound Wave Pokémon: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.

name: Xerneas
description: Life Pokémon: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

name: Yveltal
description: Destruction Pokémon: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

name: Zygarde
description: Order Pokémon: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

name: Diancie
description: Jewel Pokémon: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

name: Hoopa
description: Mischief Pokémon: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

name: Volcanion
description: Steam Pokémon: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

name: Rowlet
description: Grass Quill Pokémon: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.

name: Dartrix
description: Blade Quill Pokémon: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

name: Decidueye
description: Arrow Quill Pokémon: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.

name: Litten
description: Fire Cat Pokémon: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

name: Torracat
description: Fire Cat Pokémon: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

name: Incineroar
description: Heel Pokémon: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.

name: Popplio
description: Sea Lion Pokémon: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!

name: Brionne
description: Pop Star Pokémon: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.

name: Primarina
description: Soloist Pokémon: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.

name: Pikipek
description: Woodpecker Pokémon: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

name: Trumbeak
description: Bugle Beak Pokémon: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

name: Toucannon
description: Cannon Pokémon: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

name: Yungoos
description: Loitering Pokémon: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

name: Gumshoos
description: Stakeout Pokémon: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

name: Grubbin
description: Larva Pokémon: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.

name: Charjabug
description: Battery Pokémon: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.

name: Vikavolt
description: Stag Beetle Pokémon: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.

name: Crabrawler
description: Boxing Pokémon: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

name: Crabominable
description: Woolly Crab Pokémon: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

name: Oricorio
description: Dancing Pokémon: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

name: Cutiefly
description: Bee Fly Pokémon: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.

name: Ribombee
description: Bee Fly Pokémon: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.

name: Rockruff
description: Puppy Pokémon: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that’s proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

name: Lycanroc
description: Wolf Pokémon: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.

name: Wishiwashi
description: Small Fry Pokémon: When it’s in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.

name: Mareanie
description: Brutal Star Pokémon: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.

name: Toxapex
description: Brutal Star Pokémon: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.

name: Mudbray
description: Donkey Pokémon: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.

name: Mudsdale
description: Draft Horse Pokémon: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.

name: Dewpider
description: Water Bubble Pokémon: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.

name: Araquanid
description: Water Bubble Pokémon: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!

name: Fomantis
description: Sickle Grass Pokémon: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.

name: Lurantis
description: Bloom Sickle Pokémon: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.

name: Morelull
description: Illuminating Pokémon: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.

name: Shiinotic
description: Illuminating Pokémon: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!

name: Salandit
description: Toxic Lizard Pokémon: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn’t deal well with Spinda, since it’s always reeling.

name: Salazzle
description: Toxic Lizard Pokémon: It punishes Salandit that couldn’t bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.

name: Stufful
description: Flailing Pokémon: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.

name: Bewear
description: Strong Arm Pokémon: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.

name: Bounsweet
description: Fruit Pokémon: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It’s usually a fruitless attempt.

name: Steenee
description: Fruit Pokémon: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They’re quite painful when they smack you!

name: Tsareena
description: Fruit Pokémon: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.

name: Comfey
description: Posy Picker Pokémon: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.

name: Oranguru
description: Sage Pokémon: Oranguru don’t get along with each other, so they’re always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.

name: Passimian
description: Teamwork Pokémon: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.

name: Wimpod
description: Turn Tail Pokémon: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.

name: Golisopod
description: Hard Scale Pokémon: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.

name: Sandygast
description: Sand Heap Pokémon: If you build sand mounds when you’re playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

name: Palossand
description: Sand Castle Pokémon: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.

name: Pyukumuku
description: Sea Cucumber Pokémon: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!

name: Type: Null
description: Synthetic Pokémon: There’s danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.

name: Silvally
description: Synthetic Pokémon: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.

name: Minior
description: Meteor Pokémon: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

name: Komala
description: Drowsing Pokémon: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

name: Turtonator
description: Blast Turtle Pokémon: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.

name: Togedemaru
description: Roly-Poly Pokémon: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!

name: Mimikyu
description: Disguise Pokémon: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon’s rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.

name: Bruxish
description: Gnash Teeth Pokémon: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

name: Drampa
description: Placid Pokémon: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they’re in danger, so their moms don’t have to worry.

name: Dhelmise
description: Sea Creeper Pokémon: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.

name: Jangmo-o
description: Scaly Pokémon: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.

name: Hakamo-o
description: Scaly Pokémon: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they’re a popular item.

name: Kommo-o
description: Scaly Pokémon: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.

name: Tapu Koko
description: Land Spirit Pokémon: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

name: Tapu Lele
description: Land Spirit Pokémon: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

name: Tapu Bulu
description: Land Spirit Pokémon: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

name: Tapu Fini
description: Land Spirit Pokémon: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

name: Cosmog
description: Nebula Pokémon: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

name: Cosmoem
description: Protostar Pokémon: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

name: Solgaleo
description: Sunne Pokémon: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”

name: Lunala
description: Moone Pokémon: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

name: Nihilego
description: Parasite Pokémon: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

name: Buzzwole
description: Swollen Pokémon: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Pheromosa
description: Lissome Pokémon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Xurkitree
description: Glowing Pokémon: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

name: Celesteela
description: Launch Pokémon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Kartana
description: Drawn Sword Pokémon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Guzzlord
description: Junkivore Pokémon: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

name: Necrozma
description: Prism Pokémon: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

name: Magearna
description: Artificial Pokémon: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

name: Marshadow
description: Gloomdweller Pokémon: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

name: Poipole
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Naganadel
description: Poison Pin Pokémon: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Stakataka
description: Rampart Pokémon: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Blacephalon
description: Fireworks Pokémon: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

name: Zeraora
description: Thunderclap Pokémon: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

name: Meltan
description: Hex Nut Pokémon: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

name: Melmetal
description: Hex Nut Pokémon: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal's heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
